AR-C-60.title: General Principles for Engagements Performed in Accordance With SSARS
AR-C-60.objective: The objective of the accountant is to apply the requirements relevant to the engagement in accordance with this section.

independence.notes: Independence requirements vary by engagement type - see specific sections

keyRequirements.title: Ethical Requirements
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should comply with relevant ethical requirements, including those pertaining to independence, when applicable.

keyRequirements.title: Professional Judgment
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should exercise professional judgment in planning and performing an engagement performed in accordance with SSARS.

keyRequirements.title: Conduct of Engagement
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should plan the engagement so that it will be performed effectively, perform the engagement with professional competence, and comply with the requirements of the applicable section.

keyRequirements.title: Documentation
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should prepare documentation sufficient to enable an experienced accountant, having no previous connection with the engagement, to understand the nature, timing, and extent of the procedures performed.

keyRequirements.title: Documentation Assembly
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should assemble the documentation in an engagement file and complete the administrative process of assembling the final engagement file on a timely basis after the date of the report.

AR-C-70.title: Preparation of Financial Statements
AR-C-70.objective: The objective of the accountant in a preparation engagement is to prepare financial statements in accordance with an applicable financial reporting framework based upon information provided by management.

independence.notes: Independence is not required for preparation engagements. No disclosure of lack of independence is required.

legendOptions: No assurance is provided on these financial statements.
These financial statements have not been subjected to an audit, review, or compilation engagement, and no assurance is provided on them.

keyRequirements.title: Engagement Letter
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should agree upon the terms of the engagement with management or those charged with governance, as appropriate, and document such agreed-upon terms in an engagement letter or other suitable written agreement.

keyRequirements.title: Understanding Framework
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should possess an understanding of the applicable financial reporting framework and the significant accounting policies intended to be used in the preparation of the financial statements.

keyRequirements.title: Legend Requirement
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should include a legend on each page of the financial statements indicating that 'no assurance is provided' on the financial statements.

keyRequirements.title: Documentation
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should prepare documentation in connection with each preparation engagement that provides a sufficient record to document the engagement.

AR-C-80.title: Compilation Engagements
AR-C-80.objective: The objective of the accountant in a compilation engagement is to apply accounting and financial reporting expertise to assist management in the presentation of financial statements and report in accordance with this section without undertaking to obtain or provide any assurance.

independence.notes: Independence is not required, but lack of independence must be disclosed in the report. The reason for lack of independence cannot be disclosed.
independence.disclosureLanguage: I am (We are) not independent with respect to XYZ Company.

keyRequirements.title: Engagement Letter
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should agree upon the terms of the engagement with management or those charged with governance, as appropriate. The agreed-upon terms of the engagement should be documented in an engagement letter or other suitable written agreement.

keyRequirements.title: Understanding of Entity
keyRequirements.requirement: Prior to the issuance of the compilation report, the accountant should obtain an understanding of the entity sufficient to enable the accountant to apply accounting and financial reporting expertise.

keyRequirements.title: Reading Financial Statements
keyRequirements.requirement: Prior to the issuance of the compilation report, the accountant should read the financial statements and consider whether such financial statements appear to be appropriate in form and free from obvious material errors.

keyRequirements.title: Independence Not Required
keyRequirements.requirement: When performing compilation engagements, the accountant is not required to be independent of the entity for which the accountant is reporting.

keyRequirements.title: Substantially All Disclosures Omitted
keyRequirements.requirement: If management elects to omit substantially all disclosures required by the applicable financial reporting framework, the accountant should modify the compilation report.

keyRequirements.title: Known Departures
keyRequirements.requirement: If the accountant becomes aware that the financial statements are materially misstated, the accountant should propose appropriate revisions to management.

keyRequirements.title: Independence Disclosure
keyRequirements.requirement: When the accountant is not independent, the accountant's compilation report should specifically disclose that the accountant is not independent.

keyRequirements.title: Documentation
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should prepare documentation in connection with each compilation engagement that provides a sufficient record to document the engagement, including the procedures performed.

reportVariations.title: Compilation Report - Not Independent
reportVariations.additionalLanguage: I am (We are) not independent with respect to XYZ Company.

AR-C-90.title: Review of Financial Statements
AR-C-90.objective: The objective of the accountant when performing a review of financial statements is to obtain limited assurance as a basis for reporting whether the accountant is aware of any material modifications that should be made to the financial statements.

independence.notes: Independence is REQUIRED. If not independent, cannot issue review report. Must comply with AICPA Code of Professional Conduct.

keyRequirements.title: Engagement Letter
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should agree upon the terms of the engagement with management or those charged with governance, as appropriate. The agreed-upon terms of the engagement should be documented in an engagement letter or other suitable written agreement.

keyRequirements.title: Independence Required
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should be independent when performing a review engagement.

keyRequirements.title: Cannot Report If Not Independent
keyRequirements.requirement: If the accountant is not independent, the accountant should not report on the financial statements in accordance with this section.

keyRequirements.title: Understanding of Entity
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should obtain an understanding of the entity and its environment, including the entity's internal control, and the applicable financial reporting framework and the entity's accounting policies and practices.

keyRequirements.title: Analytical Procedures
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should apply analytical procedures to the financial statements. The analytical procedures should be designed to identify relationships and individual items that appear to be unusual.

keyRequirements.title: Inquiries
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should make inquiries of management about financial statement preparation, changes in business activities, subsequent events, fraud, noncompliance, related parties, litigation, and other matters.

keyRequirements.title: Management Representation Letter
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should request a written representation from management for all financial statements and periods covered by the accountant's review report.

keyRequirements.title: Documentation
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should prepare documentation that is sufficient to enable an experienced accountant, having no previous connection with the engagement, to understand the work performed, the significant judgments made, and the basis for the accountant's conclusion.

disclosureOptions.notes: Unlike compilations, reviews require full disclosures. Substantially all disclosures cannot be omitted.

inquiryAreas: Financial statement preparation in accordance with framework

AR-C-120.title: Compilation of Pro Forma Financial Information
AR-C-120.scope: Engagements to compile pro forma financial information
AR-C-120.objective: The objective of the accountant when performing a compilation engagement for pro forma financial information is to assist management in presenting the pro forma financial information and report in accordance with this section.

independence.notes: Same as regular compilation - independence not required but lack must be disclosed.

prerequisite.requirement: Must have compiled, reviewed, or audited the historical financial statements

keyRequirements.title: Engagement Letter
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should agree upon the terms of the engagement with management or those charged with governance, as appropriate, and document such agreed-upon terms in an engagement letter or other suitable written agreement.

keyRequirements.title: Historical Statements Requirement
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant may compile pro forma financial information only when the accountant has compiled, reviewed, or audited the historical financial statements on which the pro forma financial information is based.

keyRequirements.title: Understanding of Transaction
keyRequirements.requirement: Prior to the issuance of the report, the accountant should obtain an understanding of the transaction or event, the underlying historical financial statements, and the presentation of the pro forma financial information.

keyRequirements.title: Reading Pro Forma Information
keyRequirements.requirement: Prior to the issuance of the report, the accountant should read the pro forma financial information, including the summary of significant assumptions, and consider whether such pro forma financial information appears to be appropriate in form and free from obvious material errors.

keyRequirements.title: Independence Not Required
keyRequirements.requirement: When performing a compilation engagement for pro forma financial information, the accountant is not required to be independent of the entity.

keyRequirements.title: Documentation
keyRequirements.requirement: The accountant should prepare documentation that provides a sufficient record to document the procedures performed.

proFormaTypes.description: Combined operations as if merger/acquisition occurred earlier
Effects of new debt or equity

preparation.typicalUse: Internal financial statements, no third-party reliance

compilation.typicalUse: Third parties may use statements, no assurance needed

review.typicalUse: Bank/creditor requires assurance, more credibility needed

assemblyDeadline.description: Complete administrative process of assembling final engagement file

retentionPeriod.notes: State board rules may vary; consider client agreements and insurance requirements

documentationRequirements.standard: Documentation sufficient for experienced accountant to understand procedures performed
